Name: Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Full 12c Pot, Black
Review: I tried the K-cups with Community breakfast blend. I had coffee grinds completely throughout my coffee. It was not even drinkable. I used the filter(provided) and used my own Community breakfast blend. This second cup came out great. I did want to use the k-cups as advertised. I will update after a few more cups.

Name: Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Full 12c Pot, Black
Review: The carafe side works great but I do not want to make a full pot every day.

Name: Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Full 12c Pot, Black
Review: Update; June 29, 2017

Name: Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Full 12c Pot, Black
Review: After additional time and effort, I have concluded that the flaw is in the Community K-cups and not the

Name: Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Full 12c Pot, Black
Review: Hamilton Beach 49976 Flex brew 2-Way Brewer. I have tried several other K-cup brands and I have not had the problem with grinds throughout my cup of coffee.  I am changing my rating from 2 stars to 5 stars. It was not fair for me to rate this brewer so low. The

Name: Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Full 12c Pot, Black
Review: Hamilton Beach 49976 Flex brew 2-Way Brewer works great. The community K-cups are not what I expected.

Name: Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Full 12c Pot, Black
Review: This is the best multipurpose appliance I have ever used!  To begin with, it's easy to use, use one side or the other. I normally program my carafe side the night before so my coffee is ready in the morning. It's easy enough with this machine. I have not tried to program the single brew side, but I am sure it works well.  My only negative, which probably won't bother most coffee drinkers is that the coffee comes out too hot.  I usually place two ice cubes in my cup when I pour my morning joe.  But that's just me, most people like it hot.

Name: Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Full 12c Pot, Black
Review: The single serve, or k cup side, works great. Because of the modular design of the k cup holder, you just need to make sure when you place the k cup in, that you feel it get punctured by the bottom needle. The top needle does not need much pressure because it only punctures the foil top of the k cups, so just by closing the cover you will be fine. I use the single brew side to brew iced tea.

Name: Lavazza Professional F1NA Creation 200 Coffee Maker, Black
Review: This is leaking severely.  Ridiculous!!  My prior Flavia lasted 3 y3aqrs!!!

Name: Keurig K- Slim Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Multistream Technology, Black
Review: I don't typically write reviews, especially for something as trivial as a coffee maker, but this was an interesting journey. I had an ancient, by comparison, Keurig B55 that most resembles the "Classic" model they offer currently. Probably going on 11 years, it finally died. Up until that point, this portion of my counter was basically a coffee station, forcing me to do all my kitchen prep to the right of the stove, keeping the shrine to caffeine unadulterated.

Name: Keurig K- Slim Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Multistream Technology, Black
Review: I was stunned at all the variants of the Keurig line. It's almost dizzying and makes it nearly impossible to choose one. Some quick googling showed 60+ models, most of which are still sold. Do I need 5 cup sizes (5oz - 14oz)? How about  a "strong" setting? Does it do anything? A screen? Or a timer? Or a larger reservoir? What about no reservoir? Seriously, the paradox of choice here is maddening.

Name: Keurig K- Slim Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Multistream Technology, Black
Review: Having come from a "screened" maker in my previous model, I ended up opting for the K200 model. This one is about 3" less wide that my previous maker, so that was nice. Unfortunately, it had a few issues that I simply could not work around.

Name: Keurig K- Slim Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Multistream Technology, Black
Review: - The reservoir is U-shaped and honestly very awkward to negotiate both from a refilling and removing perspective. Especially if it's under a cabinet, and you want to refill from a refrigerator water dispenser, as I do.

Name: Keurig K- Slim Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Multistream Technology, Black
Review: - The coffee was simply not hot enough. Not sure if I got a bum unit, or that's how it is, but it was significantly less hot than what I was used to.

Name: Keurig K- Slim Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Multistream Technology, Black
Review: #NAME?

Name: Keurig K- Slim Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Multistream Technology, Black
Review: Enter the K-Slim. I was skeptical because the reviews were, pun intended, no so hot. But the price was right, and I really liked the idea of a sub five-inch width coffee maker on my countertop. This model only has 3 cup sizes, but has the same 40oz reservoir as the K200. Even better, it's a simple rectangle design that I can maneuver easily to and fro my fridge. Having the extra counter space has been such a nice benefit. But moreso, the coffee is hot and, so far, the machine reliable.

Name: Keurig K- Slim Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Multistream Technology, Black
Review: What I like:

Name: Keurig K- Slim Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Multistream Technology, Black

Name: Keurig K- Slim Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Multistream Technology, Black

Name: Cuisinart SS-15BKSP1 Coffee Center 12-Cup Coffeemaker and Single-Serve Brewer, Black Stainless Steel
Review: The low reviews on here must be Keurig purists!

Name: Cuisinart SS-15BKSP1 Coffee Center 12-Cup Coffeemaker and Single-Serve Brewer, Black Stainless Steel
Review: This machine is wonderful!

Name: Cuisinart SS-15BKSP1 Coffee Center 12-Cup Coffeemaker and Single-Serve Brewer, Black Stainless Steel
Review: From what I understand, this machine does not hold a tank of heated water ready to dispense. Instead, it instantly heats water (similar to an instant water heater...) through coils and finishes pushing the water through the coils with a small in line air pump. I kept the box for 5 months incase it failed. It hasn’t.

Name: Cuisinart SS-15BKSP1 Coffee Center 12-Cup Coffeemaker and Single-Serve Brewer, Black Stainless Steel
Review: After month 3, the “clean” light came on. That was honestly the easiest cleaning ever. —-side note to those that want everything NOW!;  Block off one whole hour to do this! I know the world may end in that time, but think of all the great insta pics you could share whilst cleaning your awesome coffee making devise. Great likes, and the next cup of joe’s even better...

Name: Cuisinart SS-15BKSP1 Coffee Center 12-Cup Coffeemaker and Single-Serve Brewer, Black Stainless Steel
Review: I’ll update this review if it doesn’t make it a year, but hey, I’ve paid for Keurig's that haven’t lasted that long!

Name: Cuisinart SS-15BKSP1 Coffee Center 12-Cup Coffeemaker and Single-Serve Brewer, Black Stainless Steel
Review: The media could not be loaded.

Name: Cuisinart SS-15BKSP1 Coffee Center 12-Cup Coffeemaker and Single-Serve Brewer, Black Stainless Steel
Review: My requirements for this item were similar to those of many other Amazon shoppers; I had a need to brew both pots and individual mugs and wanted to combine the two separate machines I was utilizing to accomplish this. Additionally, I wished to purchase a product that would best facilitate my transition into a smart home environment supported by Alexa.

Name: Cuisinart SS-15BKSP1 Coffee Center 12-Cup Coffeemaker and Single-Serve Brewer, Black Stainless Steel
Review: The first problem I had with every other mid-priced solution that combined both pot and Keurig brewing was that the single serve option required a refill on the water reservoir for each cup brewed. This was a step backward for almost every other brewer I reviewed. The Cuisinart SS-15 did not have this limitation and allows for a number of cups to be brewed before requiring a refill.

Name: Cuisinart SS-15BKSP1 Coffee Center 12-Cup Coffeemaker and Single-Serve Brewer, Black Stainless Steel
Review: The second issue I had when considering the machine for automation was if it could be attached to a smart plug to turn off and on via Alexa commands. As is the case in some smart appliances, a hard power down can cause a disruption to some appliances. The Cuisinart SS-15 can

Name: Jura D6 Automatic Coffee Machine, 1, Black
Review: We bought this and price kept dropping and amazon refused to make price adjustments, so I kept returning them until I got lowest price... leveraging the "free returns"... but I'd prefer Amazon adjust price if it drops within 30 days like most retailers (Home Depot for example).  Enough about Amazon

Name: Jura D6 Automatic Coffee Machine, 1, Black
Review: the Jura D6 is amazing machine considering how fantastic the coffee is, and all the features.  (don't bother with bluetooth stuff useless since it requires physical switch to do frothed milk).

Name: Jura D6 Automatic Coffee Machine, 1, Black
Review: The ONLY problem I had was one I read about.  Folks stated that french roast beans would not feed properly.  Generally I only use Kicking Horse coffee (Kick Ass and Decaf blended).  I do something some purists will hate... I freeze the beans.  Folks say you shouldn't and the real issue is moisture.... so if you freeze them it has to be AIR TIGHT.  I use glad slide lock freezer bags and squeeze all the air out.  I have NEVER not once had any problem with beans feeding....  UNTIL I ran out of my Kicking Horse coffee and bought ONE bag of Star Bucks French Roast.  When I opened the bag the beans seamed very oily.  Within 2 cups the feeder was NOT working.

Name: Jura D6 Automatic Coffee Machine, 1, Black
Review: I gave the rest away to a neighbor when my Kicking Horse coffee arrived... it still had a little problem feeding for about a week ( ~ 1.5lbs of beans going though ).  After a week its working perfectly.  The oily texture of Star Bucks beans is what disrupts the feeder.

Name: Jura D6 Automatic Coffee Machine, 1, Black
Review: So what I can tell you is that STAR BUCKS french roast beans will NOT work in this machine.

Name: Jura D6 Automatic Coffee Machine, 1, Black
Review: If you like french roast, try Kicking Horse Kick Ass beans.  They have a decaf version as well... this machine makes coffee so good I drink 2x as much so I use 50% Kick Ass and 50% decaf.... mix them together and freeze in an AIR TIGHT bag.  Never been happier.

Name: Jura D6 Automatic Coffee Machine, 1, Black
Review: Everyone who comes over loves the coffee and cappuccinos and never turns down a cup.

Name: BUNN VLPF, 12-Cup Automatic Commercial Coffee Maker, 2 Warmers, 07400.0005
Review: We ordered this because we had such good results from an older Bunn. Bunn the old one developed a leak after years of use. We decided that since we were going to replace it, we should upgrade. We set this one up and did each step in the instructions...carefully. Over time we ended up doing each step in the process six times trying to get the coffee maker to consistently fill a carafe. We get half pots, overrun pots, etc. And no matter what we get it will take far too long in comparison to our old one. Now we have a $600 paperweight sitting next to a cheap Black and Decker drip coffeemaker so we can at least have coffee consistently.

Name: BUNN VLPF, 12-Cup Automatic Commercial Coffee Maker, 2 Warmers, 07400.0005
Review: We tried calling for support but end up in the endless loop on hold.

Name: BUNN VLPF, 12-Cup Automatic Commercial Coffee Maker, 2 Warmers, 07400.0005
Review: I would love to give this a better review, but can only give what it deserves at this time.

Name: BUNN VLPF, 12-Cup Automatic Commercial Coffee Maker, 2 Warmers, 07400.0005
Review: I purchased this appliance for work because of the name brand -- BUNN.  It has always had a good reputation.  However, it didn't work when installed, and I called the company.  They gave me the name of a repair man who came out the next day.  That was almost two weeks ago.  He said it had a faulty part, and he talked to the company about the warranty.  They had to send him a part.  He and I have both been waiting on this part for far too long now.  In the meantime, I have been weaned from coffee!!  But my customers will still want some, so I'm stuck with the coffee pot that does not work.  The problem with sending it back is that the installers threw the packaging away, and there is no guarantee that the next one would be any better.  I'm very very very disappointed to say the least.  $560!!

Name: BUNN VLPF, 12-Cup Automatic Commercial Coffee Maker, 2 Warmers, 07400.0005
Review: Bought this for my home, as I have friends who are really in to coffee (one will drink an entire pot just before bed...)  quality is fine, just don't expect this to work like a household kitchen coffee pot.  If u don't use it all.the time, u need.to plug it in half an hour before u need coffee.  It also needs a hard plumbed water line with flare fittings - an Xtra expense.  So...  This thing makes.awesome coffee, and a lot.of it.  It looks cool on the counter.  Made in USA,.high quality, the last coffee.maker u will ever need.

Name: BUNN VLPF, 12-Cup Automatic Commercial Coffee Maker, 2 Warmers, 07400.0005
Review: I bought this for our Firehouse. The product was intermittently making a 1/2 pot in one brew, flooding the kitchen in another and anything goes in between. Only has a 30 day return policy and I didn't find out in a timely manner. Called a commercial appliance Tech to find out the unit was left in a programming mode from the factory and we had to pay it.

Name: BUNN VLPF, 12-Cup Automatic Commercial Coffee Maker, 2 Warmers, 07400.0005
Review: Love it

Name: BUNN VLPF, 12-Cup Automatic Commercial Coffee Maker, 2 Warmers, 07400.0005
Review: WELL DESIGNED AND EASY TO USE

Name: BUNN VP17-1, 12-Cup Low Profile Pourover Commercial Coffee Maker, 1 Warmer, 13300.0001
BUNN VP17-1, 12-Cup Low Profile Pourover Commercial Coffee Maker, 1 Warmer, 13300.0001

The only reason I can assume the tip kit is not included is that different model coffee makers must flow differently.  I've included a few screen grabs of the catalog so you can see for yourself.

Name: GE Drip Coffee Maker With Timer | 10-Cup Thermal Carafe Coffee Pot Keeps Coffee Warm for 2 Hours | Adjustable Brew Strength | Wide Shower Head for Maximum Flavor | Kitchen Essentials | Stainless Steel
Review: I love coffee and over time I have accumulated different coffee makers for different occasions. When I have time or company I brew an elegant pour over with my Chemex, for example. Or I use a Keurig for a quick cup to take in the car. But in the dark winter mornings it is lovely to simply wake to the aroma of a freshly brewed pot of coffee and to know it will stay hot in the stainless steel carafe. I can prepare this GE the night before and in the morning all I have to do is pour my cup!  The digital display is simple and stylish (blue display). It is really easy to set the current time as well as the brew timer, unlike many things these days. The “bold” setting really makes a delicious difference if the coffee lends itself to that.  The display illuminates when you set it but then goes dark after a bit so it is not distracting. It’s very classy on the counter. Absolutely no drips from the carafe. And no beeps from this machine. This uses a #4 cone filter. All the coffee I have prepared with this is delicious. It seems substantial and well made, and I would purchase it again. There is really nothing I don’t like about it, as it does what it promises. Well done, GE!

Name: Ninja CP307 Hot and Cold Brewed System, Auto-iQ Tea and Coffee Maker with 6 Brew Sizes, 5 Brew Styles, Frother, Coffee & Tea Baskets with Thermal Carafe Black 50 oz.
Review: WARNING - THIS IS AN IN DEPTH REVIEW FOR THOSE INTERESTING IN MAKING A SERIOUS BUYING DECISION.  If you prefer a summary, see section marked THE BOTTOM LINE

Name: Ninja CP307 Hot and Cold Brewed System, Auto-iQ Tea and Coffee Maker with 6 Brew Sizes, 5 Brew Styles, Frother, Coffee & Tea Baskets with Thermal Carafe Black 50 oz.
Review: SET UP

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 2 Quart, Black
Review: This is a really well made product.  It makes it super easy to brew your own loose leaf iced tea.  Dropping the infuser into hot water is really simple since it screws into the lid of the pitcher.  After brewing, you lift it back out and drop it into the cup they provide (a nice touch, even though any cup would do the same job).  Fill it the rest of the way with ice and screw down the top and shake.  This is actually a really nice feature.  The tall design of the pitcher prevents you from splashing yourself with hot tea when dropping in the ice.  And, by sealing down tight, you can shake your tea until it's cold.  (When I was looking online, I thought this was just a marketing gimmick, but it makes a huge difference in how quickly you get to enjoy your iced tea.). And, it fits really well on the refrigerator door.

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 2 Quart, Black
Review: If I were going to make a single improvement to the design, I'd make it so the bottom of the infuser can be unscrewed to allow for better cleaning.  Also, I've noticed that darker teas will stain the mesh of the infuser.  A thorough cleaning with soap and water helps. but a stainless steel design might have been better for this.

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 2 Quart, Black
Review: I researched Iced Tea makers a while before I bought this one.  Here are my Pros and Cons about the Takeya Iced Tea Maker:

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 2 Quart, Black
Review: Pros:

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 2 Quart, Black
Review: Fun Colors

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 2 Quart, Black
Review: Easy to follow directions

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 2 Quart, Black
Review: Can add tea as well as fruit to the infuser to make your own "concoction" of fruit flavored water or teas

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 2 Quart, Black
Review: Cons:

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 2 Quart, Black
Review: When you go to pour yourself a nice tall glass of tea, make sure to pour OVER a sink. The poor design of the lid/spout has caused many a spills. The flow is not "consistent" so it can make a mess.

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 2 Quart, Black
Review: The infuser itself is a mess when you try to clean all of the tea out of it. Just when you think you have shaken it all out, there is still some more in there.

Name: Hamilton Beach FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Espresso Machine with 19 Bar Pump, 56 oz. Removable Reservoir, Black
Hamilton Beach FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Espresso Machine with 19 Bar Pump, 56 oz. Removable Reservoir, Black

Name: Hamilton Beach 49979 FlexBrew Single-Serve Coffee Maker Compatible with Pod Packs and Grounds, Black & Chrome
Hamilton Beach 49979 FlexBrew Single-Serve Coffee Maker Compatible with Pod Packs and Grounds, Black & Chrome
Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: Hamilton Beach products are thoughtfully designed to make your life easier. We use consumer insights, in-depth research and rigorous testing to deliver the best solution to your everyday needs.

Name: Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: Whether it's preparing delicious meals and beverages effortlessly, or making your clothes look their best, you can count on the brand that has spent over 100 years creating products with you in mind.

Name: Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: My headline says it all about this unit. Previous maker was a budget Mr. Coffee with VERY accurate reviews about it dripping when pulling pot off warmer. It was a mess. I thought a drip or two would be a issue but it was a lot! So...started looking for a coffee maker again. Wife and I love our coffee so this one was a bonus at 14 cups(only one that I know if that has this capacity)  Plus, we like the Hamilton Beach brand. So, it's been a couple of weeks and MANY pots of coffee made and we really love the maker. Brews the 14 cups FAST and it looks great on the counter as well. While you can simply use the cone screen filter that comes with it, like most screen filters it's a bit of a pain in the butt to get all the grounds washed out so we bought the specific cone style filters and they work great and makes clean up easier.  Can't recommend enough.

Name: Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: I like that this is easy to use and program, and that it fits nicely on the counter. It makes a good cup of coffee, and is supremely quiet, which is nice since my last one sounded like a car transmission on its last legs. I also like how easily the top of the pot comes off and how nicely it locks in place.

Name: Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: However, a few things to note:

Name: Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: #NAME?

Name: Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: #NAME?

Name: Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: -I don't like that the water gauge is only ever 2 cups. Not the end of the world but frustrating for those of us who know exactly how much coffee they want.

Name: Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: -Does not stay hot. I don't know what's up with this pot. It stays warm, for sure, but it never gets really hot, not even fresh, and it only gets cooler from there. I have to warm up my coffee within an hour or two of it being in the pot.

Name: Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: I like it, it's fine. But there are a few small tweaks that could have been made to make it perfect and I don't understand why the heating element is so much weaker than I've had in the past.

Name: Hamilton Beach Programmable Front-Fill Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe (46391), 12 Cup Capacity, Black and Stainless
Review: I wanted to switch to a thermal pot after the glass carafe on my other Hamilton Beach coffee maker broke, but many coffee makers seemed ridiculously overpriced. I didn't necessarily care if it was the same brand but this just happened to catch my eye. The main reason? Front filling. The convenient feature I didn't even know I was looking for! We have a small kitchen with limited counter apace and low hanging cabinets. With the old coffee maker, I had to pull it out from the wall to pour the water everytime. Not anymore! That small thing hooked me. Plus the lower price was a benefit as well. A great bargain.

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 1 Quart, Avocado
Review: This is a really well made product.  It makes it super easy to brew your own loose leaf iced tea.  Dropping the infuser into hot water is really simple since it screws into the lid of the pitcher.  After brewing, you lift it back out and drop it into the cup they provide (a nice touch, even though any cup would do the same job).  Fill it the rest of the way with ice and screw down the top and shake.  This is actually a really nice feature.  The tall design of the pitcher prevents you from splashing yourself with hot tea when dropping in the ice.  And, by sealing down tight, you can shake your tea until it's cold.  (When I was looking online, I thought this was just a marketing gimmick, but it makes a huge difference in how quickly you get to enjoy your iced tea.). And, it fits really well on the refrigerator door.

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 1 Quart, Avocado
Review: If I were going to make a single improvement to the design, I'd make it so the bottom of the infuser can be unscrewed to allow for better cleaning.  Also, I've noticed that darker teas will stain the mesh of the infuser.  A thorough cleaning with soap and water helps. but a stainless steel design might have been better for this.

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 1 Quart, Avocado
Review: I researched Iced Tea makers a while before I bought this one.  Here are my Pros and Cons about the Takeya Iced Tea Maker:

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 1 Quart, Avocado
Review: Pros:

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 1 Quart, Avocado
Review: Fun Colors

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 1 Quart, Avocado
Review: Easy to follow directions

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 1 Quart, Avocado
Review: Can add tea as well as fruit to the infuser to make your own "concoction" of fruit flavored water or teas

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 1 Quart, Avocado
Review: Cons:

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 1 Quart, Avocado
Review: When you go to pour yourself a nice tall glass of tea, make sure to pour OVER a sink. The poor design of the lid/spout has caused many a spills. The flow is not "consistent" so it can make a mess.

Name: Takeya Iced Tea Maker with Patented Flash Chill Technology Made in USA, 1 Quart, Avocado
Review: The infuser itself is a mess when you try to clean all of the tea out of it. Just when you think you have shaken it all out, there is still some more in there.

Name: Cuisinart PRC-12FR Classic Stainless Percolator, Stainless Steel (Renewed)
Review: Ok everyone.  There are many simple solutions to all the problems you may be encountering.  First, coffee grounds in your coffee, buy cheap coffee filters tear a little hole in the center and slide it around the brew rod.  Second, coffee getting cold, leave it plugged in until your finished drinking, it will not harm it.  I do it all the time and have for years.  Third, fill the water to the 12 cup line, eyeball putting your coffee in the filter one placed in the basket.  Leave 1/4 inch from the top.  I like it strong.  You can do coarse ground coffee and bypass the regular coffee filter but the coarser the coffee the weaker the coffee.  I am an avid coffee drinker and have been for years.  I have tried every coffee maker around, but always go back to this one.  Hope this helps!!!

Name: Cuisinart PRC-12FR Classic Stainless Percolator, Stainless Steel (Renewed)
Review: I had a percolator like this for a long time. It had gotten to where it didn’t make the coffee as hot as it use to. When someone broke the glass piece on the top I had to replace it. I bought this replacement with some apprehension because it was a refurbished unit. It is just as good as a new unit, and now my coffee piping hot just as I like it.

Name: Cuisinart PRC-12FR Classic Stainless Percolator, Stainless Steel (Renewed)
Review: The pot is very stylish it replaced a presto 12 cup which stopped working. This pot makes excellent coffee the only complaint I have is after brewing the stay warm feature could be better doesn't keep the coffee hot just warm. It's worth the purchase.

Name: Cuisinart PRC-12FR Classic Stainless Percolator, Stainless Steel (Renewed)
Review: Coffee pot worked exactly as expected and the flavor from the coffee is excellent. Coffee pot is stainless steel (except for support at bottom) and it makes 12 cups of great coffee in less than 10 minutes.

Name: Cuisinart PRC-12FR Classic Stainless Percolator, Stainless Steel (Renewed)
Review: Makes really good coffee and the coffee is hotter than with my former coffee maker that used plastic pods.

Name: Cuisinart PRC-12FR Classic Stainless Percolator, Stainless Steel (Renewed)
Review: I decided to go old school and buy a percolator for my morning coffee…I love this. I highly recommend!!

Name: Cuisinart PRC-12FR Classic Stainless Percolator, Stainless Steel (Renewed)
Review: I bought this after reading the reviews and got a great price as it was refurbished.  It is very sleek, doesn't take up a lot of room on the counter & makes great coffee in around 4 minutes.  We simply fold a regular coffee filter into quarters & tear a very small hole to fit over the inside piece, use regular ground coffee (put your finger over the top of the metal tube that fits into the clear top piece to keep coffee out of the pot circulation).  The smell & sound of coffee perking was missing with our Bunn drip coffee maker.  The coffee is hotter than the Bunn too. We love it & have actually ordered a total of 4 for gifts & to have an extra percolator when this one burns out.

Name: Cuisinart PRC-12FR Classic Stainless Percolator, Stainless Steel (Renewed)
Review: Taste way better than my Keurig, no plastic flavor, which isn’t healthy.

Name: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Review: A large proportion of product reviews, whether positive or negative, are subjective declarations of personal tastes that are either met or not. Likes and preferences are debatable. What is not debatable is the fact that the grinder that I purchased failed to operate 10 weeks after I first started using it.  Dead, nothing, zero.

Name: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Review: I had been grinding a measured amount of beans sufficient for one mug-full of coffee daily. I consistently cleaned the grind chamber after each use and thoroughly cleaned the bean hopper, burr grinding plates and the grind release area once weekly.

Name: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Review: This product, The Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill, has long been criticized for:

Name: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Review: #NAME?

Name: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Review: #NAME?

Name: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Review: -The grinding times are not dependable:  Even when set for the longest grinding time, the burr mill would routinely stop before completely grinding the 35g of beans that I had pre-measured. Since I never relied on this feature to begin with, that this function routinely failed to operate correctly was an annoyance but not an important feature for me.

Name: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Review: The mediocre performance of this machine gave me little user satisfaction but I was at least able to make a decent cup of coffee with the fresh grounds that it so ineptly produced. Despite this machine's considerable number of flaws, I would not have reviewed this product had it at least continued to work. I would have lived with the sub-entry-level-grinder deficiencies that plague this machine which at this price point are not unreasonable to expect.

Name: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Review: That the Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill utterly failed after such a short period of light usage and regular care and that so many others reported having had a similar experience, are the facts that I cannot overlook. These are facts that I believe to be worthy of your consideration before making this purchase my friends.

Name: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Review: They say if it isn't broke, don't fix it. Well, in this case, it was broke, but it lasted eight years! So, we had to replace it and why not go with the same unit when we had such great success using it to grind our daily coffee?! This is a very nice burr mill that we have gained much use from over the years and now we replace it with a brand new unit that is exactly like the other one and hoping we get another 8-10 years out of it.

Name: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Review: Why do we like it?

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: Since I am the only person in my house who drinks coffee I purchased this little gem!! It's simple to use, makes terrific coffee, and doesn't take up a lot of space on my countertop. Brews very quietly too!!

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: This little coffee maker is just right for my two giant mugs of brew per morning: it makes delicious java, its small footprint and stainless steel design gives it a stylish cuteness, and it’s simple to operate.

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: The one problem? No auto shutoff. For someone like me, who’s prone to getting absorbed in other things, I need that assurance. I bought an auto shutoff timer for the plug, which is fine. But, c’mon Krups, please add, what seems to me, should be a standard feature!

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: Hint: use no. 2 paper cone filters, not the recommended no. 4.

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: I had two Keurig machines that I wasn't fond of. The water wasn't really hot and I couldn't find coffee that impressed me. It always seemed so weak and diluted. So I decided to give the KRUPS a try to compare. You give up the convenience of the K-cups, but I wasn't using them anyways. I had purchased one of the reusable K-cup pods and using my own coffee. The problem is I still wasn't happy with the coffee.

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: The KRUPS (at least the one I received) makes the water hotter and the basket is bigger allowing for enough coffee to suit your taste. The Krups comes with a reusable mesh basket filter. I don't like cleaning the filter and prefer the ease of throwing out a paper filter. With this one you can use the small paper filters (1-4 cup) available almost anywhere. I would've preferred they designed the KRUPS with a cone filter rather than a basket filter. From everything I've read, the cone design extracts the most flavor from the coffee.

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: I like the stainless steel tumbler. It looks very sleek and stylish. It does get a little warm when first brewed. There is a 2 year warranty on the KRUPS. The coffee maker has a On/Off switch and another switch to start the brew cycle. It brews a tumbler full in fairly short order.

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: I really like the KRUPS and prefer this over my old Keurig and another single serve brew machine I've tried. It may not be a perfect machine, but for a single serve coffee maker, it's the best I have tried so far. I give it ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ as I'm happy with it.

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: Thanks for Reading -  ✌😉

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: Ever purchase something that once you used it you just knew that the people who designed it and approved it never used it even once? That's the case here. The lid of the carafe will not stay open because it opens up only to exactly the vertical and then flops closed. If it opened say 10 degrees past vertical, then when on the counter and I'm attempting to pour in the water from my Zero Water pitcher it would stay open on its own. Also, difficult to pour water into the reservoir because of the design of the lit on the unit. Will not open far enough to be out of the way. A safety issue is the poor placement of the on/off switch. It's on the side at the bottom. I keep it plugged in on my counter all the time with other things near like a toaster and other items. When moving it around during to day to use other items, if it even slightly bumps agains something else, the rocker switch turns on and it is not noticable because of its location. So, a number of times I've had it on and not know it. A huge safety ussue regarding overheating as it could be on all day and damage the unit or even start a fire. It does brew a nice hot cup of coffee but a very poor and dangerous design. How could the manufacturere not know all of this if they ever used it? Going to return it to Amazon.

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: I've had this for about a month now and am liking it very much.  I haven't taken the water temperature as it comes out of the spray head, but the coffee is good and hot.  I love that it takes up very little space on the counter.  I grind the beans and use filtered water, and I make the largest amount it will take.  My Contigo thermos fits on the base, and in that, the coffee stays hot for several hours.  I use a paper filter instead of the included filter as I don't like any sediment.  A size 2 paper filter folded so the sides are a little bit straighter fits very well.

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: Love this adorable little coffee maker! The stainless steel is pretty & matches my appliances nicely. It’s the perfect coffee maker if you are looking for something small.

Name: KRUPS Simply Brew Family Drip Coffee Maker, 10-Cup, Black & Stainless Steel
Review: Krups is exceptional as usual....smooth coffee....permanent filter....well constructed....easy to clean

Name: Cuisinart DCC-3400P1 12-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker with Thermal Carafe, Stainless Steel
Review: This review is for the DCC-3400 machine with a thermal carafe. This machine makes great tasting coffee, has simple intuitive operation, does not take up much space on the counter, and is *really* good looking. I recently purchased this to replace a similar Cuisinart model that I had for over 12 years. And the previous one was still working fine - it had just gotten dingy after daily use for so many years. I prefer using a thermal carafe because I usually stretch a pot of coffee over several hours, and coffee gets a burnt taste when heated for that long with a heating plate. The primary advantage of the thermal carafe (besides looking really nice) is that it keeps the coffee hot through insulation of the carafe, and not by continuously heating the carafe. So there are three things you need to know (1) the plate that it sits on does not heat up, (2) coffee in the carafe is going to lose heat over the course of a day; that is physics and it's unavoidable. However, it loses heat at a very slow rate. The coffee remains hot for several hours throughout the morning after it has been brewed, and even by the afternoon I would call it very warm - that's 9-10 hours after it was brewed and would be burnt coffee sludge if it were directly heated for that long, and (3) the lid is designed to maintain a seal that reduces the rate of heat loss, but you don't have to twist or open anything to pour a cup. For this reason, the coffee pours more slowly than if the spout were just open. But honestly, the difference is along the lines of taking 4 seconds to fill a cup instead of 2 seconds. I don't understand the claims in other reviews about spilling when pouring, unless they are turning the carafe upside down to try to make it pour faster. The spout pours just fine and I've noticed that this model actually pours a little faster than the previous one I had. If the spout were more open, the carafe would lose heat more quickly. The only way to seal it further would be to design a lid that needs to be twisted open when you want to pour (like a thermos), and it would still lose heat at a faster rate every time you open it. I feel that the design of this carafe strikes the right balance between the seal needed to retain heat and ease of pouring. Another bonus is that the carafe does not need to sit in the coffee maker to stay warm - when serving coffee to a group I can keep the pot right on the table or wherever is most convenient. A thermal carafe may not fit the bill for everyone, but if you need a pot of coffee to stay hot for several hours without eventually tasting burnt, I highly recommend this machine.

Name: Cuisinart DCC-3400P1 12-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker with Thermal Carafe, Stainless Steel
Review: 3 for now, but I'll revise later... why are so many of these reviews for the DCC-3200 rather than the DCC-3400?

Name: Cuisinart DCC-3400P1 12-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker with Thermal Carafe, Stainless Steel
Review: UPDATE: a week later.

Name: Cuisinart DCC-3400P1 12-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker with Thermal Carafe, Stainless Steel
Review: Okay, there, 5 stars.  It took a few pots to get the grind, water, filter, brewing time vectors all sorted out but I think I'm there now.  Yep, makes great coffee.  I confess I went a bit crazy (after the first pot came out mediocre) -- I got out my instant read thermometer and tracked the water temp up to only 187F... a bit below what you'd really want, but I'm not sure I can tell how much better those last 10 degrees will make it, plus, my thermometer might be off a bit. ;^)  In any case, I made side by side cups using pour over right out of the kettle thinking I'd catch a problem with the DCC-3400, but nope.  I couldn't tell them apart.  So, yay.  (Oh, and for me this worked out to a fine/fine-medium grind, unbleached filters, the BOLD setting, and one scoop more coffee than cups on the water level indicator (i.e. 9 scoops to 8 "cups").

Name: Cuisinart DCC-3400P1 12-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker with Thermal Carafe, Stainless Steel
Review: I think, starting over, I'd look harder at the SCAA approved KitcheAid units (which were a little less expensive -- but I got this pot and a grinder on an Amazon Prime Day special).  But I am now happy.  Reports and updates may follow later.

Name: Cuisinart DCC-3400P1 12-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker with Thermal Carafe, Stainless Steel
Review: Cuisinart DCC-3400 Thermal Coffeemaker, Carafe, overall is an excellent machine. Note that I've only had it about a month. This was a purchase made from frustration with the typical "glass" carafes with most machines. I always break them, then must replace the whole machine. Waste of money and upsetting to boot. Stainless steel was a logical choice, but expensive. Two drawbacks, more a nuisance than a complaint. 1) The water fill spot is narrow, wedged in the back right side corner. I use a funnel to pour the water into it, so problem solved. 2) Except for the first two cups, the carafe pours steadily albeit slowly, due to the seal between the carafe and the lid to it. Not unexpected, as air must be permitted to enter to let the coffee pour out. Plus on this is I'm less likely to miss the cup while pouring, and it has a hefty pour spout too, so aiming is no problem, no drips.

Name: Cuisinart DCC-3400P1 12-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker with Thermal Carafe, Stainless Steel
Review: On the plus side, it makes a terrific cup of coffee, at least for me, and I use cheap coffee. Five loud beeps sound when the pot is done. Coffee stays warm for about an hour, but a microwave is required if you want it hot after, depending on taste. Plus here is your coffee is never burnt due to a hot plate. (it doesn't have one.) Coffee hours later, no problem, just warm it in your cup. Tastes just like fresh.

Name: Cuisinart DCC-3400P1 12-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker with Thermal Carafe, Stainless Steel
Review: Controls are the simplest in any machine I've had, and I've lost count of them. Easy to clean, it's self cleaning with vinegar & seems to work great. Allow at least 30 minutes for the cycle, and it notifies you when it needs cleaning. I have not used the charcoal filter, so no opinion. Now, lets see if I can manage to break this one?

Name: Programmable Coffee Maker, 12 Cups Coffee Pot with Timer and Glass Carafe, Brew Strength Control, Keep Warming, Mid-Brew Pause, Coffee Machine with Permanent Coffee Filter Basket, Anti-Drip System
Review: My coffee maker broke at the beginning of lockdown/quarantine in March when all stores were closed and going out was rare. I doubtfully headed to amazon never having purchased anything electronic on here, but after much searching and reviewing and budgeting. I came to this one. I love that the light in blue, not green (maybe not a big detail for some but when a girl works on her home esthetic, a little blue light is everything) It's fast, efficient, has the re-usable filter, easy to clean, makes a lot of coffee and just all around perfect.

Name: Programmable Coffee Maker, 12 Cups Coffee Pot with Timer and Glass Carafe, Brew Strength Control, Keep Warming, Mid-Brew Pause, Coffee Machine with Permanent Coffee Filter Basket, Anti-Drip System
Review: Love it. If you need a cute stainless steal coffee maker that is pretty standard, easy to use and just perfectly efficient, get this one. You wont regret it! I went through all these coffee makers and for this price you can't really beat it.

Name: Programmable Coffee Maker, 12 Cups Coffee Pot with Timer and Glass Carafe, Brew Strength Control, Keep Warming, Mid-Brew Pause, Coffee Machine with Permanent Coffee Filter Basket, Anti-Drip System
Review: This is a great coffee pot; although the directions in their manual were a bit confusing, we were able to figure it out. There’s a button that said ‘Thick’ and I believe that meant ‘strong’ and sure enough, that’s what it was.  It’s self-shutoff after two hours and keeps coffee hot and makes a good cup of ‘joe.

Name: Programmable Coffee Maker, 12 Cups Coffee Pot with Timer and Glass Carafe, Brew Strength Control, Keep Warming, Mid-Brew Pause, Coffee Machine with Permanent Coffee Filter Basket, Anti-Drip System
Review: The only negative I have is the water chamber lid doesn’t go far enough back which makes it tough to pour water in the chamber when using the coffee carafe.

Name: Programmable Coffee Maker, 12 Cups Coffee Pot with Timer and Glass Carafe, Brew Strength Control, Keep Warming, Mid-Brew Pause, Coffee Machine with Permanent Coffee Filter Basket, Anti-Drip System
Review: I bought this to replace an insulated carafe coffee maker because I never felt like it stayed warm. We’ve been using it for a couple months now, and I’m SO happy we switched!! So simple to prepare and clean, nice rich coffee flavors, and my pot stays good and hot! Great buy at a great price point. We ended up gifting one as well!

Name: Programmable Coffee Maker, 12 Cups Coffee Pot with Timer and Glass Carafe, Brew Strength Control, Keep Warming, Mid-Brew Pause, Coffee Machine with Permanent Coffee Filter Basket, Anti-Drip System
Review: I really like the coffee maker.  The instructions were not too clear for me, so you have to set the delay timer by pressing "program" 3 times & that sets it.  I hope that helps you.

Name: Programmable Coffee Maker, 12 Cups Coffee Pot with Timer and Glass Carafe, Brew Strength Control, Keep Warming, Mid-Brew Pause, Coffee Machine with Permanent Coffee Filter Basket, Anti-Drip System
Review: The only thing I don't like is that the clock is in military time, but I really don't use my coffee maker to see what time it is.  So not really a big deal.

Name: Programmable Coffee Maker, 12 Cups Coffee Pot with Timer and Glass Carafe, Brew Strength Control, Keep Warming, Mid-Brew Pause, Coffee Machine with Permanent Coffee Filter Basket, Anti-Drip System
Review: It only displays military time.  First device I ve ever seen that this is the only option..  Huge, bright military time, sitting in my kitchen.  It sucks!  So mad I didn't read reviews first.  I'm going to return it.

Name: Single Serve Coffee Maker, Personal Coffee Brewer Machine 3 in 1 for Capsule pod, Loose Leaf Tea & Ground Coffee, 50oz Removable Water Reservoir, For Home&Office
Review: Great coffee machine. I like the best is the it come with coffee pod so I can put own coffee and tea, and even my Nepresso pod. Capacities is ok, I like large coffee and it has 10 oz size as biggest. Very easy to use and size is good fit to kitchen

Name: Single Serve Coffee Maker, Personal Coffee Brewer Machine 3 in 1 for Capsule pod, Loose Leaf Tea & Ground Coffee, 50oz Removable Water Reservoir, For Home&Office
Review: So far I am happy with this coffee maker. It has only been 2 weeks and I have only used the pod for ground coffee but the flavor is great. It is easy to use. I like the water reservoir so I don't have to add water every time. I have been using filtered water in it.

Name: Single Serve Coffee Maker, Personal Coffee Brewer Machine 3 in 1 for Capsule pod, Loose Leaf Tea & Ground Coffee, 50oz Removable Water Reservoir, For Home&Office
Review: Si

Name: Single Serve Coffee Maker, Personal Coffee Brewer Machine 3 in 1 for Capsule pod, Loose Leaf Tea & Ground Coffee, 50oz Removable Water Reservoir, For Home&Office
Review: Slow brewing. Not the best coffee maker for the price.

Name: Single Serve Coffee Maker, Personal Coffee Brewer Machine 3 in 1 for Capsule pod, Loose Leaf Tea & Ground Coffee, 50oz Removable Water Reservoir, For Home&Office
Review: title says it all

Name: Single Serve Coffee Maker, Personal Coffee Brewer Machine 3 in 1 for Capsule pod, Loose Leaf Tea & Ground Coffee, 50oz Removable Water Reservoir, For Home&Office
Review: The media could not be loaded.

Name: Single Serve Coffee Maker, Personal Coffee Brewer Machine 3 in 1 for Capsule pod, Loose Leaf Tea & Ground Coffee, 50oz Removable Water Reservoir, For Home&Office
Review: It's about 6:30am and I am writing a review.  That should tell you something about this coffee maker right?! I just love it! It made the perfect cup of coffee for one. It seems like everyone is trying to declutter and downsize what's on kitchen counters. This is perfect for a very small space. It has a nice sized tank in the back for the water though. You can fill it for quite a few cups of coffee. I filled it last night to see if it leaks. Nope. Dry as a bone on my counter top. That would have been a deal breaker if it leaked. The coffee was made quick and it tasted just like it smelled... wonderful. I like the fact there's absolutely no clean up. No pot to have to wash or filter mess. Just throw the preloaded pod you may have purchased away or rinse out the pod that you can fill with your own coffee. I'm choosing to spoil myself right now with a purchased variety pack of pods. If you are a tea drinker you aren't left out! There's an included loose tea pod to make the perfect cup of tea. I sat down with my cup of coffee right after it was done. It was plenty hot enough but I did have to nuke it to make it piping hot! Not an issue for me. Coffee is never stays hot enough for me unless I put it in an insulated mug. This is a great purchase and highly recommend it! Enjoy!!

Name: Single Serve Coffee Maker, Personal Coffee Brewer Machine 3 in 1 for Capsule pod, Loose Leaf Tea & Ground Coffee, 50oz Removable Water Reservoir, For Home&Office
Review: I have a complicated espresso machine for those times when I want an "advanced" drink. But many times, I need a single cup quickly. I began looking at single-cup machines. I wanted one that was very competent. The machine needed to be easy to use, but also make good coffee. No point in getting a bad cup of coffee no matter what machine you use! I came across this one from SIFENE, and decided to give it a try. After using it for a few weeks, I'm very happy with it.

Name: Hamilton Beach FlexBrew Trio 2-Way Coffee Maker, Compatible with K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Combo, Single Serve & Full 12c Pot, White
